Reason: The configuration option _gLow is performance-sensitive. It directly influences the starting point for loops in the code, affecting the range of values used in the flap function. The flap function is crucial for the hashing process and key derivation, impacting system performance and security. Changing the _gLow value can lead to notable performance variations at the system level due to its impact on time-expensive and memory-expensive operations within the related code.
